qas.question: When was the Japanese siege of Imphal broken?
How many troops had the Japanese lost?
What was the main cause of death of the Japanese troops?

context: As many Japanese had feared, Japan's supply arrangements could not maintain her forces. Once Mutaguchi's hopes for an early victory were thwarted, his troops, particularly those at Kohima, <a0_0>starved<a0_0/>. During May, while Mutaguchi continued to order attacks, the Allies advanced southwards from Kohima and northwards from Imphal. The two Allied attacks met on <a1_0>22 June<a1_0/>, breaking the Japanese siege of Imphal. The Japanese finally broke off the operation on 3 July. They had lost over <a2_0>50,000<a2_0/> troops, mainly to <a3_0>starvation and disease<a3_0/>. This represented the worst defeat suffered by the Japanese Army to that date.[citation needed]
